# ShoreSquad Project Instructions

This workspace contains the ShoreSquad beach cleanup rally app - a modern web application designed to mobilize young people for beach cleanups with weather tracking, maps, and social features.

## Project Structure
- `index.html` - HTML5 semantic markup with accessibility features
- `css/styles.css` - Ocean-inspired color palette with responsive design
- `js/app.js` - Interactive features with performance optimizations
- `.vscode/` - Live Server configuration and development tasks
- `.github/` - Project documentation and instructions

## Development Guidelines
- Follow mobile-first responsive design principles
- Use semantic HTML with proper ARIA labels for accessibility
- Maintain ocean-inspired color palette (blues, sandy neutrals, coral accents)
- Implement smooth animations and transitions
- Ensure cross-browser compatibility
- Optimize for performance and user experience

## Key Features
- Interactive cleanup event discovery
- Real-time weather tracking
- Squad management and social features
- Progressive Web App ready structure
- Local storage for data persistence

## Getting Started
1. Right-click `index.html` and select "Open with Live Server"
2. The app will launch at `http://localhost:3000`
3. Use the browser's developer tools for testing and debugging

## Target Audience
Young people (16-30) who are environmentally conscious, tech-savvy, and community-oriented.
